author: Brian Turner
method: Cut a slit lengthways into the chicken breast. To make the polenta stuffing, put the quick-cook polenta in a mixing bowl and quickly whisk in the hot chicken stock. Stir in the gorgonzola and butter.  Stuff the chicken breast with the mixture, pushing the stuffing into the slit. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and fry the chicken breast, skin side down, for 5-7 minutes or until crisp and golden. Turn the chicken over and finish cooking on the other side for a further five minutes or until cooked through.  Serve on top stir-fried chard or green vegetables of your choice.
ingredients: 1 chicken breast with skin on,  100g/3½oz quick-cook polenta,  300ml/10½fl oz hot chicken stock,  50g/1¾oz gorgonzola,  1 tbsp butter,  1 tbsp olive oil,  Stir-fried chard, to serve (optional)
